verses.original: शुक्लाम्बरधरं विष्णुं शशिवर्णं चतुर्भुजम् । प्रसन्नवदनं ध्यायेत् सर्वविघ्नोपशान्तये ॥ १॥
verses.transliteration: śuklāmbaradharaṃ viṣṇuṃ śaśivarṇaṃ caturbhujam . prasannavadanaṃ dhyāyet sarvavighnopaśāntaye .. 1..
verses.translation: I meditate upon Vishnu, who is wearing white garments, who is the color of the moon, who has four arms, and whose face is benign. I meditate upon Him for the removal of all obstacles.

verses.original: व्यासं वसिष्ठनप्तारं शक्तेः पौत्रमकल्मषम् । पराशरात्मजं वन्दे शुकतातं तपोनिधिम् ॥ ३॥
verses.transliteration: vyāsaṃ vasiṣṭhanaptāraṃ śakteḥ pautramakalmaṣam . parāśarātmajaṃ vande śukatātaṃ taponidhim .. 3..
verses.translation: I salute Vyāsa, the great grandson of Vasiṣṭha, the grandson of Śakti, the son of Parāśara, the father of Śuka, and a treasure of penance, who is free from blemish.

verses.original: व्यासाय विष्णुरूपाय व्यासरूपाय विष्णवे । नमो वै ब्रह्मनिधये वासिष्ठाय नमो नमः ॥ ४॥
verses.transliteration: vyāsāya viṣṇurūpāya vyāsarūpāya viṣṇave . namo vai brahmanidhaye vāsiṣṭhāya namo namaḥ .. 4..
verses.translation: Salutations to Vyāsa, who is the form of Vishnu, and to Vishnu, who is the form of Vyāsa. Salutations again and again to that treasure of the Veda, Vāsiṣṭha (Vyāsa).

verses.original: अविकाराय शुद्धाय नित्याय परमात्मने । सदैकरूपरूपाय विष्णवे सर्वजिष्णवे ॥ ५॥
verses.transliteration: avikārāya śuddhāya nityāya paramātmane . sadaikarūparūpāya viṣṇave sarvajiṣṇave .. 5..
verses.translation: Salutations to Vishnu, the ever-victorious Lord of all, who is changeless, pure, eternal, the Supreme Self, and whose form is always one and the same.

verses.original: यस्य स्मरणमात्रेण जन्मसंसारबन्धनात् । विमुच्यते नमस्तस्मै विष्णवे प्रभविष्णवे ॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration: yasya smaraṇamātreṇa janmasaṃsārabandhanāt . vimucyate namastasmai viṣṇave prabhaviṣṇave .. 6..
verses.translation: One is liberated from the bondage of birth and Saṃsāra merely by remembering Him. Salutations to that all-powerful Vishnu.

verses.original: ॐ नमो विष्णवे प्रभविष्णवे । श्रीवैशम्पायन उवाच — श्रुत्वा धर्मानशेषेण पावनानि च सर्वशः । युधिष्ठिरः शान्तनवं पुनरेवाभ्यभाषत ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration: oṃ namo viṣṇave prabhaviṣṇave . śrīvaiśampāyana uvāca — śrutvā dharmānaśeṣeṇa pāvanāni ca sarvaśaḥ . yudhiṣṭhiraḥ śāntanavaṃ punarevābhyabhāṣata .. 7..
verses.translation: Om, salutations to Vishnu, the all-powerful! Śrī Vaiśampāyana said: Having heard all the sacred and purifying duties completely, Yudhiṣṭhira again addressed Śāntanava (Bhīṣma).

verses.original: युधिष्ठिर उवाच — किमेकं दैवतं लोके किं वाप्येकं परायणम् । स्तुवन्तः कं कमर्चन्तः प्राप्नुयुर्मानवाः शुभम् ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration: yudhiṣṭhira uvāca — kimekaṃ daivataṃ loke kiṃ vāpyekaṃ parāyaṇam . stuvantaḥ kaṃ kamarcantaḥ prāpnuyurmānavāḥ śubham .. 8..
verses.translation: Yudhiṣṭhira said: Who is the one supreme Deity in the world? Or, who is the one ultimate refuge? By praising whom and by worshipping whom do mortals attain blessedness?

verses.original: को धर्मः सर्वधर्माणां भवतः परमो मतः । किं जपन्मुच्यते जन्तुर्जन्मसंसारबन्धनात् ॥ ९॥
verses.transliteration: ko dharmaḥ sarvadharmāṇāṃ bhavataḥ paramo mataḥ . kiṃ japanmucyate janturjanmasaṃsārabandhanāt .. 9..
verses.translation: What, in your opinion, is the highest Dharma among all Dharmas? By reciting what does a living being become liberated from the bondage of birth and Saṃsāra?

verses.original: भीष्म उवाच — जगत्प्रभुं देवदेवमनन्तं पुरुषोत्तमम् । स्तुवन् नामसहस्रेण पुरुषः सततोत्थितः ॥ १०॥
verses.transliteration: bhīṣma uvāca — jagatprabhuṃ devadevamanantaṃ puruṣottamam . stuvan nāmasahasreṇa puruṣaḥ satatotthitaḥ .. 10..
verses.translation: Bhīṣma said: A person, by praising the Lord of the universe, the God of gods, the endless, the Supreme Person (Puruṣottama), with the thousand names (Sahasranāma), being constantly intent on Him—

verses.original: तमेव चार्चयन्नित्यं भक्त्या पुरुषमव्ययम् । ध्यायन् स्तुवन् नमस्यंश्च यजमानस्तमेव च ॥ ११॥
verses.transliteration: tameva cārcayannityaṃ bhaktyā puruṣamavyayam . dhyāyan stuvan namasyaṃśca yajamānastameva ca .. 11..
verses.translation: —and by daily worshipping that immutable Puruṣa with devotion, by meditating on Him, praising Him, bowing to Him, and worshipping Him through sacrifices—

verses.original: अनादिनिधनं विष्णुं सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् । लोकाध्यक्षं स्तुवन्नित्यं सर्वदुःखातिगो भवेत् ॥ १२॥
verses.transliteration: anādinidhanaṃ viṣṇuṃ sarvalokamaheśvaram . lokādhyakṣaṃ stuvannityaṃ sarvaduḥkhātigo bhavet .. 12..
verses.translation: —by constantly praising Vishnu, who is without beginning or end, the great Lord of all worlds, and the ruler of the worlds, one transcends all sorrows.

verses.original: ब्रह्मण्यं सर्वधर्मज्ञं लोकानां कीर्तिवर्धनम् । लोकनाथं महद्भूतं सर्वभूतभवोद्भवम् ॥ १३॥
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇyaṃ sarvadharmajñaṃ lokānāṃ kīrtivardhanam . lokanāthaṃ mahadbhūtaṃ sarvabhūtabhavodbhavam .. 13..
verses.translation: (He is) the protector of Brahman (Vedas, Brāhmaṇas, or Supreme Reality), the knower of all Dharmas, the enhancer of the fame of the worlds, the Lord of the worlds, the great Being, and the source of the origin of all created beings.

verses.original: एष मे सर्वधर्माणां धर्मोऽधिकतमो मतः । यद्भक्त्या पुण्डरीकाक्षं स्तवैरर्चेन्नरः सदा ॥ १४॥
verses.transliteration: eṣa me sarvadharmāṇāṃ dharmo’dhikatamo mataḥ . yadbhaktyā puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ stavairarcennaraḥ sadā .. 14..
verses.translation: This, in my opinion, is the highest Dharma among all Dharmas: that a person should always worship the Lotus-Eyed Lord (Puṇḍarīkākṣa) with devotion and hymns of praise.

verses.original: परमं यो महत्तेजः परमं यो महत्तपः । परमं यो महद्ब्रह्म परमं यः परायणम् ॥ १५॥
verses.transliteration: paramaṃ yo mahattejaḥ paramaṃ yo mahattapaḥ . paramaṃ yo mahadbrahma paramaṃ yaḥ parāyaṇam .. 15..
verses.translation: (He is) the highest great splendor, the highest great austerity, the highest great Brahman, and the highest ultimate refuge.

verses.original: पवित्राणां पवित्रं यो मङ्गलानां च मङ्गलम् । दैवतं दैवतानां च भूतानां योऽव्ययः पिता ॥ १६॥
verses.transliteration: pavitrāṇāṃ pavitraṃ yo maṅgalānāṃ ca maṅgalam . daivataṃ daivatānāṃ ca bhūtānāṃ yo’vyayaḥ pitā .. 16..
verses.translation: (He is) the purity of the pure, the auspiciousness of the auspicious, the Deity of the Deities, and the indestructible father of all beings.

verses.original: यतः सर्वाणि भूतानि भवन्त्यादियुगागमे । यस्मिंश्च प्रलयं यान्ति पुनरेव युगक्षये ॥ १७॥
verses.transliteration: yataḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni bhavantyādiyugāgame . yasmiṃśca pralayaṃ yānti punareva yugakṣaye .. 17..
verses.translation: From whom all beings originate at the beginning of the Yuga (cycle of time), and into whom they again dissolve at the dissolution of the Yuga.

verses.original: तस्य लोकप्रधानस्य जगन्नाथस्य भूपते । विष्णोर्नामसहस्रं मे शृणु पापभयापहम् ॥ १८॥
verses.transliteration: tasya lokapradhānasya jagannāthasya bhūpate . viṣṇornāmasahasraṃ me śṛṇu pāpabhayāpaham .. 18..
verses.translation: O King (Yudhiṣṭhira), listen now to the thousand names (Nāmasahasra) of that foremost of the worlds, the Lord of the Universe (Jagannātha), Vishnu, which removes all sins and fears.

verses.original: यानि नामानि गौणानि विख्यातानि महात्मनः । ऋषिभिः परिगीतानि तानि वक्ष्यामि भूतये ॥ १९॥
verses.transliteration: yāni nāmāni gauṇāni vikhyātāni mahātmanaḥ . ṛṣibhiḥ parigītāni tāni vakṣyāmi bhūtaye .. 19..
verses.translation: I shall relate those famous names of the Mahātman (Great Soul), which are descriptive of His qualities, and which have been sung by the Ṛṣis, for the sake of prosperity.

verses.original: ऋषिर्नाम्नां सहस्रस्य वेदव्यासो महामुनिः ॥ छन्दोऽनुष्टुप् तथा देवो भगवान् देवकीसुतः ॥ २०॥
verses.transliteration: ṛṣirnāmnāṃ sahasrasya vedavyāso mahāmuniḥ .. chando’nuṣṭup tathā devo bhagavān devakīsutaḥ .. 20..
verses.translation: The Ṛṣi (seer) for this thousand names is the great sage Vedavyāsa. The meter is Anuṣṭup, and the Deity is the worshipful son of Devakī (Kṛṣṇa).

verses.original: अमृतांशूद्भवो बीजं शक्तिर्देवकिनन्दनः । त्रिसामा हृदयं तस्य शान्त्यर्थे विनियोज्यते ॥ २१॥
verses.transliteration: amṛtāṃśūdbhavo bījaṃ śaktirdevakinandanaḥ . trisāmā hṛdayaṃ tasya śāntyarthe viniyojyate .. 21..
verses.translation: The Bīja (seed) is Amṛtāṃśūdbhava (the moon), the Śakti (power) is Devakīnandana (the delight of Devakī), and the Hṛdaya (heart/core) is Trisāmā. This is employed for the sake of peace (Śānti).

verses.original: विष्णुं जिष्णुं महाविष्णुं प्रभविष्णुं महेश्वरम् ॥ अनेकरूप दैत्यान्तं नमामि पुरुषोत्तमं ॥ २२ ॥
verses.transliteration: viṣṇuṃ jiṣṇuṃ mahāviṣṇuṃ prabhaviṣṇuṃ maheśvaram .. anekarūpa daityāntaṃ namāmi puruṣottamaṃ .. 22 ..
verses.translation: I bow to Puruṣottama (the Supreme Person), who is Vishnu, the Victorious (Jiṣṇu), the Great Vishnu, the All-Powerful (Prabhaviṣṇu), the Great Lord (Maheśvara), and who, though of many forms, is the destroyer of the Daitvas (demons).
